An object representing the Application.
Allows the developer to execute, show and close an application, as well as show and hide an icon on Desktop. Also provides access to the Window object for the main application window to control window state such as the ability to minimize, maximize, restore, etc.

member.summary: Registers an event listener on the specified event.
member.remarks: Supported system event types are: closed crashed error not-responding out-of-memory responding run-requested started
member.param: A JSON object containing subscription information such as the topic and type.
A function that is called whenever an event of the specified type occurs. It is passed an event object containing information related to the event.

member.summary: Closes the application

member.summary: Passes a list of wrapped child windows for the current application to childHandler.

(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.summary:
Removes a previously registered event listener from the specified event.
The listener is passed an event object containing information related to the event.
member.remarks: Supported system event types are: closed crashed error not-responding out-of-memory responding started
member.param: The type of the event.
A function that was called whenever an event of the specified type occurs. It is no longer called in response to an event of the passed type.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method succeeds.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

The high-order word specifies the vertical position of the cursor, in s creen coordinates, if a window menu command is chosen with the mouse. This parameter is â€“1 if the command is chosen using a system accelerator, or zero if using a mnemonic.

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult
member.summary:
Encapsulates and sends the result of an ExternalWindow action to the desktop. The result is sent after invocation of an ExternalWindow method.
In cases where this behavior needs to be prevented, such as when work done should be handled by another thread, Set PreventAutomaticSend to true and call send() when the result state is determined.
send() will be called automatically by Dispose() if it has not been explicitly called prior.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult.#ctor(Openfin.Desktop.DesktopConnection,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an instance.

The message ID to map this result back to any pending callbacks in other apps.

member.param: True when the operation was successful
When succeeded is false, a reason is sent on error.

member.summary: Will call send() if not done so already.

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.ExternalWindowAckResult.PreventAutomaticSend
member.summary: Prevents send() from being called directly after invocation of an ExternalWindow method. If prevented send() must be called explicitly otherwise it will be called on Dispose().

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.Notification
member.summary:
A Notification represents a window on App Desktop which is shown briefly to the user on the bottom-right corner of the primary monitor.
A notification is typically used to alert the user of some important event which requires his or her attention.
member.remarks: Multiple notifications can be generated at once but will queue if more than 5 are already displayed. Notifications can be dismissed by dragging them to the right with the mouse and can communicate securely with their invoking applications.

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.DesktopSystem
member.summary:
An object representing the core of the OpenFin Desktop. Allows the developer to perform system-level actions, such as accessing logs, viewing processes, clearing the cache and exiting the Desktop.
In order to use the System object, an application must have admin-level privileges (e.g., isAdmin must be set to true when in the options when the application is created).

member.remarks: The returned object takes the form: [ { cpuUsage: (decimal) the percentage of total CPU usage, name: (string) the application name, nonPagedPoolUsage: (integer) the current nonpaged pool usage in bytes, pageFaultCount: (integer) the number of page faults, pagedPoolUsage: (integer) the current paged pool usage in bytes, pagefileUsage: (integer) the total amount of memory in bytes that the memory manager has committed, peakNonPagedPoolUsage: (integer) the peak nonpaged pool usage in bytes, peakPagedPoolUsage: (integer) the peak paged pool usage in bytes, peakPagefileUsage: (integer) the peak value in bytes of pagefileUsage during the lifetime of this process, peakWorkingSetSize: (integer) the peak working set size in bytes, processId: (integer) the native process identifier, uuid: (string) the application UUID, workingSetSize: (integer) the current working set size (both shared and private data) in bytes }, ... ]
member.param: A function that is called and passed the process list.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group. The user can subsequently change the keyboard focus from one control in the group to the next control in the group by using the direction keys. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_SIZEFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style. You can turn this style on and off to change dialog box navigation. To change this style after a window has been created, use the SetWindowLong function. For user-created windows and modeless dialogs to work with tab stops, alter the message loop to call the IsDialogMessage function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStyles.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.Invalidate
member.summary: Invalidates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_INVALIDATE invalidates the entire window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.InternalPaint
member.summary: Causes the OS to post a WM_PAINT message to the window regardless of whether a portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.Erase
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. Specify this value in combination with the RDW_INVALIDATE value; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.Validate
member.summary: Validates the rectangle or region that you specify in lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate. You can set only one of these parameters to a non-NULL value. If both are NULL, RDW_VALIDATE validates the entire window. This value does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.NoErase
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.NoChildren
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.AllChildren
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.UpdateNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND and WM_PAINT messages before the RedrawWindow returns, if necessary.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.RedrawWindowFlags.EraseNow
member.summary: Causes the affected windows, which you specify by setting the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN values, to receive WM_ERASEBKGND messages before RedrawWindow returns, if necessary. The affected windows receive WM_PAINT messages at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: Specifies a window that accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Specifies a window that paints all descendants in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. This cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC. This style is not supported in Windows 2000.
member.remarks: With WS_EX_COMPOSITED set, all descendants of a window get bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. Bottom-to-top painting order allows a descendent window to have translucency (alpha) and transparency (color-key) effects, but only if the descendent window also has the WS_EX_TRANSPARENT bit set. Double-buffering allows the window and its descendents to be painted without flicker.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: Specifies a window that includes a question mark in the title bar. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message. The child window should pass the message to the parent window procedure, which should call the WinHelp function using the HELP_WM_HELP command. The Help application displays a pop-up window that typically contains help for the child window. WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP cannot be used with the WS_MAXIMIZEBOX or WS_MINIMIZEBOX styles.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: Specifies a window which contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a double border.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: Specifies a window that is a layered window. This cannot be used for child windows or if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: Specifies a window with the horizontal origin on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: Specifies a window that has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Specifies a window with the vertical scroll bar (if present) to the left of the client area. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: Specifies a window that displays text using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: Specifies a multiple-document interface (MDI) child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Specifies a top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. The window does not appear on the taskbar by default. To force the window to appear on the taskbar, use the WS_EX_APPWINDOW style. To activate the window, use the SetActiveWindow or SetForegroundWindow function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: Specifies a window which does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: Specifies that a child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies an overlapped window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies a palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: Specifies a window that has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect. Using the WS_EX_RIGHT style has the same effect as using the SS_RIGHT (static), ES_RIGHT (edit), and BS_RIGHT/BS_RIGHTBUTTON (button) control styles.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: Specifies a window with the vertical scroll bar (if present) to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: Specifies a window that displays text using right-to-left reading-order properties. The shell language must support reading-order alignment for this to take effect.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window with a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: Specifies a window that is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: Specifies a window that should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Specifies a window that should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted. To achieve transparency without these restrictions, use the SetWindowRgn function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WindowStylesEx.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: Specifies a window that has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.Summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.Summary: Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.Summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.Summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOMOVE
member.Summary: Retains the current position (ignores the x and y parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.Summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.Summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.Summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOSIZE
member.Summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.DeferWindowPosCommands.SWP_NOZORDER
member.Summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SpecialWindowHandles
member.summary: Special window handles

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_TOP
member.summary: Places the window at the top of the Z order.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_BOTTOM
member.summary: Places the window at the bottom of the Z order. If the hWnd parameter identifies a topmost window, the window loses its topmost status and is placed at the bottom of all other windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_TOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows. The window maintains its topmost position even when it is deactivated.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SpecialWindowHandles.HWND_NOTOPMOST
member.summary: Places the window above all non-topmost windows (that is, behind all topmost windows). This flag has no effect if the window is already a non-topmost window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.SetWindowPosFlags.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: T:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM
member.summary: Windows Messages Defined in winuser.h from Windows SDK v6.1 Documentation pulled from MSDN.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NULL
member.summary: The WM_NULL message performs no operation. An application sends the WM_NULL message if it wants to post a message that the recipient window will ignore.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CREATE
member.summary: The WM_CREATE message is sent when an application requests that a window be created by calling the CreateWindowEx or CreateWindow function. (The message is sent before the function returns.) The window procedure of the new window receives this message after the window is created, but before the window becomes visible.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DESTROY
F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOVE message is sent after a window has been moved.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SIZE
member.summary: The WM_SIZE message is sent to a window after its size has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATE message is sent to both the window being activated and the window being deactivated. If the windows use the same input queue, the message is sent synchronously, first to the window procedure of the top-level window being deactivated, then to the window procedure of the top-level window being activated. If the windows use different input queues, the message is sent asynchronously, so the window is activated immediately.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_SETFOCUS message is sent to a window after it has gained the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.KILLFOCUS
member.summary: The WM_KILLFOCUS message is sent to a window immediately before it loses the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ENABLE
member.summary: The WM_ENABLE message is sent when an application changes the enabled state of a window. It is sent to the window whose enabled state is changing. This message is sent before the EnableWindow function returns, but after the enabled state (WS_DISABLED style bit) of the window has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETREDRAW
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETREDRAW message to a window to allow changes in that window to be redrawn or to prevent changes in that window from being redrawn.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETTEXT message to set the text of a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETTEXT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXT message to copy the text that corresponds to a window into a buffer provided by the caller.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETTEXTLENGTH
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETTEXTLENGTH message to determine the length, in characters, of the text associated with a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PAINT
member.summary: The WM_PAINT message is sent when the system or another application makes a request to paint a portion of an application's window. The message is sent when the UpdateWindow or RedrawWindow function is called, or by the DispatchMessage function when the application obtains a WM_PAINT message by using the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CLOSE
member.summary: The WM_CLOSE message is sent as a signal that a window or an application should terminate.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUERYENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_QUERYENDSESSION message is sent when the user chooses to end the session or when an application calls one of the system shutdown functions. If any application returns zero, the session is not ended. The system stops sending WM_QUERYENDSESSION messages as soon as one application returns zero. After processing this message, the system sends the WM_ENDSESSION message with the wParam parameter set to the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUERYOPEN
member.summary: The WM_QUERYOPEN message is sent to an icon when the user requests that the window be restored to its previous size and position.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ENDSESSION
member.summary: The WM_ENDSESSION message is sent to an application after the system processes the results of the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message. The WM_ENDSESSION message informs the application whether the session is ending.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUIT
member.summary: The WM_QUIT message indicates a request to terminate an application and is generated when the application calls the PostQuitMessage function. It causes the GetMessage function to return zero.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ERASEBKGND
member.summary: The WM_ERASEBKGND message is sent when the window background must be erased (for example, when a window is resized). The message is sent to prepare an invalidated portion of a window for painting.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSCOLORCHANGE
member.summary: This message is sent to all top-level windows when a change is made to a system color setting.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: The WM_SHOWWINDOW message is sent to a window when the window is about to be hidden or shown.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.WININICHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file. The SystemParametersInfo function sends this message after an application uses the function to change a setting in WIN.INI. Note The WM_WININICHANGE message is provided only for compatibility with earlier versions of the system. Applications should use the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETTINGCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_WININICHANGE message to all top-level windows after making a change to the WIN.INI file. The SystemParametersInfo function sends this message after an application uses the function to change a setting in WIN.INI. Note The WM_WININICHANGE message is provided only for compatibility with earlier versions of the system. Applications should use the WM_SETTINGCHANGE message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DEVMODECHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DEVMODECHANGE message is sent to all top-level windows whenever the user changes device-mode settings.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ACTIVATEAPP
member.summary: The WM_ACTIVATEAPP message is sent when a window belonging to a different application than the active window is about to be activated. The message is sent to the application whose window is being activated and to the application whose window is being deactivated.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.FONTCHANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_FONTCHANGE message to all top-level windows in the system after changing the pool of font resources.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.TIMECHANGE
member.summary: A message that is sent whenever there is a change in the system time.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CANCELMODE
member.summary: The WM_CANCELMODE message is sent to cancel certain modes, such as mouse capture. For example, the system sends this message to the active window when a dialog box or message box is displayed. Certain functions also send this message explicitly to the specified window regardless of whether it is the active window. For example, the EnableWindow function sends this message when disabling the specified window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETCURSOR
member.summary: The WM_SETCURSOR message is sent to a window if the mouse causes the cursor to move within a window and mouse input is not captured.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSEACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEACTIVATE message is sent when the cursor is in an inactive window and the user presses a mouse button. The parent window receives this message only if the child window passes it to the DefWindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CHILDACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_CHILDACTIVATE message is sent to a child window when the user clicks the window's title bar or when the window is activated, moved, or sized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUEUESYNC
member.summary: The WM_QUEUESYNC message is sent by a computer-based training (CBT) application to separate user-input messages from other messages sent through the WH_JOURNALPLAYBACK Hook procedure.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETMINMAXINFO
member.summary: The WM_GETMINMAXINFO message is sent to a window when the size or position of the window is about to change. An application can use this message to override the window's default maximized size and position, or its default minimum or maximum tracking size.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PAINTICON
member.summary: Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The WM_PAINTICON message is sent to a minimized window when the icon is to be painted. This message is not sent by newer versions of Microsoft Windows, except in unusual circumstances explained in the Remarks.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ICONERASEBKGND
member.summary: Windows NT 3.51 and earlier: The WM_ICONERASEBKGND message is sent to a minimized window when the background of the icon must be filled before painting the icon. A window receives this message only if a class icon is defined for the window; otherwise, WM_ERASEBKGND is sent. This message is not sent by newer versions of Windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NEXTDLGCTL
member.summary: The WM_NEXTDLGCTL message is sent to a dialog box procedure to set the keyboard focus to a different control in the dialog box.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SPOOLERSTATUS
member.summary: The WM_SPOOLERSTATUS message is sent from Print Manager whenever a job is added to or removed from the Print Manager queue.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DRAWITEM
member.summary: The WM_DRAWITEM message is sent to the parent window of an owner-drawn button, combo box, list box, or menu when a visual aspect of the button, combo box, list box, or menu has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MEASUREITEM
member.summary: The WM_MEASUREITEM message is sent to the owner window of a combo box, list box, list view control, or menu item when the control or menu is created.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DELETEITEM
member.summary: Sent to the owner of a list box or combo box when the list box or combo box is destroyed or when items are removed by the LB_DELETESTRING, LB_RESETCONTENT, CB_DELETESTRING, or CB_RESETCONTENT message. The system sends a WM_DELETEITEM message for each deleted item. The system sends the WM_DELETEITEM message for any deleted list box or combo box item with nonzero item data.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.VKEYTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_KEYDOWN message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CHARTOITEM
member.summary: Sent by a list box with the LBS_WANTKEYBOARDINPUT style to its owner in response to a WM_CHAR message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETFONT message to specify the font that a control is to use when drawing text.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETFONT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETFONT message to a control to retrieve the font with which the control is currently drawing its text.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_SETHOTKEY message to a window to associate a hot key with the window. When the user presses the hot key, the system activates the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETHOTKEY
member.summary: An application sends a WM_GETHOTKEY message to determine the hot key associated with a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUERYDRAGICON
member.summary: The WM_QUERYDRAGICON message is sent to a minimized (iconic) window. The window is about to be dragged by the user but does not have an icon defined for its class. An application can return a handle to an icon or cursor. The system displays this cursor or icon while the user drags the icon.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.COMPAREITEM
member.summary: The system sends the WM_COMPAREITEM message to determine the relative position of a new item in the sorted list of an owner-drawn combo box or list box. Whenever the application adds a new item, the system sends this message to the owner of a combo box or list box created with the CBS_SORT or LBS_SORT style.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETOBJECT
member.summary: Active Accessibility sends the WM_GETOBJECT message to obtain information about an accessible object contained in a server application. Applications never send this message directly. It is sent only by Active Accessibility in response to calls to AccessibleObjectFromPoint, AccessibleObjectFromEvent, or AccessibleObjectFromWindow. However, server applications handle this message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.COMPACTING
member.summary: The WM_COMPACTING message is sent to all top-level windows when the system detects more than 12.5 percent of system time over a 30- to 60-second interval is being spent compacting memory. This indicates that system memory is low.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.COMMNOTIFY
member.summary: WM_COMMNOTIFY is Obsolete for Win32-Based Applications

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.WINDOWPOSCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order is about to change as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.WINDOWPOSCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED message is sent to a window whose size, position, or place in the Z order has changed as a result of a call to the SetWindowPos function or another window-management function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.POWER
member.summary: Notifies applications that the system, typically a battery-powered personal computer, is about to enter a suspended mode. Use: POWERBROADCAST

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.COPYDATA
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPYDATA message to pass data to another application.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CANCELJOURNAL
member.summary: The WM_CANCELJOURNAL message is posted to an application when a user cancels the application's journaling activities. The message is posted with a NULL window handle.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NOTIFY
member.summary: Sent by a common control to its parent window when an event has occurred or the control requires some information.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message is posted to the window with the focus when the user chooses a new input language, either with the hotkey (specified in the Keyboard control panel application) or from the indicator on the system taskbar. An application can accept the change by passing the message to the DefWindowProc function or reject the change (and prevent it from taking place) by returning immediately.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INPUTLANGCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_INPUTLANGCHANGE message is sent to the topmost affected window after an application's input language has been changed. You should make any application-specific settings and pass the message to the DefWindowProc function, which passes the message to all first-level child windows. These child windows can pass the message to DefWindowProc to have it pass the message to their child windows, and so on.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.TCARD
member.summary: Sent to an application that has initiated a training card with Microsoft Windows Help. The message informs the application when the user clicks an authorable button. An application initiates a training card by specifying the HELP_TCARD command in a call to the WinHelp function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HELP
member.summary: Indicates that the user pressed the F1 key. If a menu is active when F1 is pressed, WM_HELP is sent to the window associated with the menu; otherwise, WM_HELP is sent to the window that has the keyboard focus. If no window has the keyboard focus, WM_HELP is sent to the currently active window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.USERCHANGED
member.summary: The WM_USERCHANGED message is sent to all windows after the user has logged on or off. When the user logs on or off, the system updates the user-specific settings. The system sends this message immediately after updating the settings.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NOTIFYFORMAT
member.summary: Determines if a window accepts ANSI or Unicode structures in the WM_NOTIFY notification message. WM_NOTIFYFORMAT messages are sent from a common control to its parent window and from the parent window to the common control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CONTEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_CONTEXTMENU message notifies a window that the user clicked the right mouse button (right-clicked) in the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.STYLECHANGING
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGING message is sent to a window when the SetWindowLong function is about to change one or more of the window's styles.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.STYLECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_STYLECHANGED message is sent to a window after the SetWindowLong function has changed one or more of the window's styles

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DISPLAYCHANGE
member.summary: The WM_DISPLAYCHANGE message is sent to all windows when the display resolution has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETICON
member.summary: The WM_GETICON message is sent to a window to retrieve a handle to the large or small icon associated with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SETICON
member.summary: An application sends the WM_SETICON message to associate a new large or small icon with a window. The system displays the large icon in the ALT+TAB dialog box, and the small icon in the window caption.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCCREATE
member.summary: The WM_NCCREATE message is sent prior to the WM_CREATE message when a window is first created.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCDESTROY
member.summary: The WM_NCDESTROY message informs a window that its nonclient area is being destroyed. The DestroyWindow function sends the WM_NCDESTROY message to the window following the WM_DESTROY message. WM_DESTROY is used to free the allocated memory object associated with the window. The WM_NCDESTROY message is sent after the child windows have been destroyed. In contrast, WM_DESTROY is sent before the child windows are destroyed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCCALCSIZE
member.summary: The WM_NCCALCSIZE message is sent when the size and position of a window's client area must be calculated. By processing this message, an application can control the content of the window's client area when the size or position of the window changes.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCHITTEST
member.summary: The WM_NCHITTEST message is sent to a window when the cursor moves, or when a mouse button is pressed or released. If the mouse is not captured, the message is sent to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is sent to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_NCPAINT message is sent to a window when its frame must be painted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCACTIVATE
member.summary: The WM_NCACTIVATE message is sent to a window when its nonclient area needs to be changed to indicate an active or inactive state.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETDLGCODE
member.summary: The WM_GETDLGCODE message is sent to the window procedure associated with a control. By default, the system handles all keyboard input to the control; the system interprets certain types of keyboard input as dialog box navigation keys. To override this default behavior, the control can respond to the WM_GETDLGCODE message to indicate the types of input it wants to process itself.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYNCPAINT
member.summary: The WM_SYNCPAINT message is used to synchronize painting while avoiding linking independent GUI threads.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCMOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor is moved within the nonclient area of the window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCLBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCLBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCLBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCLBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCRBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCRBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCRBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCRBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCMBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCMBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCMBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCMBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is within the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCXBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCXBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCXBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_NCXBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X button while the cursor is in the nonclient area of a window. This message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. If a window has captured the mouse, this message is not posted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE
member.summary: The WM_INPUT_DEVICE_CHANGE message is sent to the window that registered to receive raw input. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INPUT
member.summary: The WM_INPUT message is sent to the window that is getting raw input.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.KEYFIRST
member.summary: This message filters for keyboard messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CHAR
member.summary: The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_CHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_DEADCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYUP message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_DEADCHAR specifies a character code generated by a dead key. A dead key is a key that generates a character, such as the umlaut (double-dot), that is combined with another character to form a composite character. For example, the umlaut-O character (Ã–) is generated by typing the dead key for the umlaut character, and then typing the O key.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key â€” that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSDEADCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSDEADCHAR message is sent to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. WM_SYSDEADCHAR specifies the character code of a system dead key â€” that is, a dead key that is pressed while holding down the ALT key.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.UNICHAR
member.summary: The WM_UNICHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_UNICHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed. The WM_UNICHAR message is equivalent to WM_CHAR, but it uses Unicode Transformation Format (UTF)-32, whereas WM_CHAR uses UTF-16. It is designed to send or post Unicode characters to ANSI windows and it can can handle Unicode Supplementary Plane characters.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.KEYLAST
member.summary: This message filters for keyboard messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_STARTCOMPOSITION
member.summary: Sent immediately before the IME generates the composition string as a result of a keystroke. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_ENDCOMPOSITION
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME ends composition. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_COMPOSITION
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME changes composition status as a result of a keystroke. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INITDIALOG
member.summary: The WM_INITDIALOG message is sent to the dialog box procedure immediately before a dialog box is displayed. Dialog box procedures typically use this message to initialize controls and carry out any other initialization tasks that affect the appearance of the dialog box.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.COMMAND
member.summary: The WM_COMMAND message is sent when the user selects a command item from a menu, when a control sends a notification message to its parent window, or when an accelerator keystroke is translated.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSCOMMAND
member.summary: A window receives this message when the user chooses a command from the Window menu, clicks the maximize button, minimize button, restore button, close button, or moves the form. You can stop the form from moving by filtering this out.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.TIMER
member.summary: The WM_TIMER message is posted to the installing thread's message queue when a timer expires. The message is posted by the GetMessage or PeekMessage function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard horizontal scroll bar. This message is also sent to the owner of a horizontal scroll bar control when a scroll event occurs in the control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.VSCROLL
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLL message is sent to a window when a scroll event occurs in the window's standard vertical scroll bar. This message is also sent to the owner of a vertical scroll bar control when a scroll event occurs in the control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INITMENU
member.summary: The WM_INITMENU message is sent when a menu is about to become active. It occurs when the user clicks an item on the menu bar or presses a menu key. This allows the application to modify the menu before it is displayed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.INITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: The WM_INITMENUPOPUP message is sent when a drop-down menu or submenu is about to become active. This allows an application to modify the menu before it is displayed, without changing the entire menu.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MENUSELECT
member.summary: The WM_MENUSELECT message is sent to a menu's owner window when the user selects a menu item.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MENUCHAR
member.summary: The WM_MENUCHAR message is sent when a menu is active and the user presses a key that does not correspond to any mnemonic or accelerator key. This message is sent to the window that owns the menu.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ENTERIDLE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERIDLE message is sent to the owner window of a modal dialog box or menu that is entering an idle state. A modal dialog box or menu enters an idle state when no messages are waiting in its queue after it has processed one or more previous messages.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MENURBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MENURBUTTONUP message is sent when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is on a menu item.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MENUDRAG
member.summary: The WM_MENUDRAG message is sent to the owner of a drag-and-drop menu when the user drags a menu item.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MENUGETOBJECT
member.summary: The WM_MENUGETOBJECT message is sent to the owner of a drag-and-drop menu when the mouse cursor enters a menu item or moves from the center of the item to the top or bottom of the item.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.UNINITMENUPOPUP
member.summary: The WM_UNINITMENUPOPUP message is sent when a drop-down menu or submenu has been destroyed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MENUCOMMAND
member.summary: The WM_MENUCOMMAND message is sent when the user makes a selection from a menu.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CHANGEUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_CHANGEUISTATE message to indicate that the user interface (UI) state should be changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.UPDATEUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_UPDATEUISTATE message to change the user interface (UI) state for the specified window and all its child windows.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUERYUISTATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_QUERYUISTATE message to retrieve the user interface (UI) state for a window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLORMSGBOX
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORMSGBOX message is sent to the owner window of a message box before Windows draws the message box. By responding to this message, the owner window can set the text and background colors of the message box by using the given display device context handle.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLOREDIT
member.summary: An edit control that is not read-only or disabled sends the WM_CTLCOLOREDIT message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the specified device context handle to set the text and background colors of the edit control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLORLISTBOX
member.summary: Sent to the parent window of a list box before the system draws the list box. By responding to this message, the parent window can set the text and background colors of the list box by using the specified display device context handle.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLORBTN
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORBTN message is sent to the parent window of a button before drawing the button. The parent window can change the button's text and background colors. However, only owner-drawn buttons respond to the parent window processing this message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLORDLG
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORDLG message is sent to a dialog box before the system draws the dialog box. By responding to this message, the dialog box can set its text and background colors using the specified display device context handle.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The WM_CTLCOLORSCROLLBAR message is sent to the parent window of a scroll bar control when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the display context handle to set the background color of the scroll bar control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CTLCOLORSTATIC
member.summary: A static control, or an edit control that is read-only or disabled, sends the WM_CTLCOLORSTATIC message to its parent window when the control is about to be drawn. By responding to this message, the parent window can use the specified device context handle to set the text and background colors of the static control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSEFIRST
member.summary: Use WM_MOUSEFIRST to specify the first mouse message. Use the PeekMessage() Function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEMOVE message is posted to a window when the cursor moves. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window that contains the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.LBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.LBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.LBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the left mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.RBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.RBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.RBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the right mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the middle mouse button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSEWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEWHEEL message is sent to the focus window when the mouse wheel is rotated. The DefWindowProc function propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chain until it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.XBUTTONDOWN
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDOWN message is posted when the user presses the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.XBUTTONUP
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONUP message is posted when the user releases the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.XBUTTONDBLCLK
member.summary: The WM_XBUTTONDBLCLK message is posted when the user double-clicks the first or second X button while the cursor is in the client area of a window. If the mouse is not captured, the message is posted to the window beneath the cursor. Otherwise, the message is posted to the window that has captured the mouse.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSEHWHEEL
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEHWHEEL message is sent to the focus window when the mouse's horizontal scroll wheel is tilted or rotated. The DefWindowProc function propagates the message to the window's parent. There should be no internal forwarding of the message, since DefWindowProc propagates it up the parent chain until it finds a window that processes it.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSELAST
member.summary: Use WM_MOUSELAST to specify the last mouse message. Used with PeekMessage() Function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: The WM_PARENTNOTIFY message is sent to the parent of a child window when the child window is created or destroyed, or when the user clicks a mouse button while the cursor is over the child window. When the child window is being created, the system sends WM_PARENTNOTIFY just before the CreateWindow or CreateWindowEx function that creates the window returns. When the child window is being destroyed, the system sends the message before any processing to destroy the window takes place.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ENTERMENULOOP
member.summary: The WM_ENTERMENULOOP message informs an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been entered.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.EXITMENULOOP
member.summary: The WM_EXITMENULOOP message informs an application's main window procedure that a menu modal loop has been exited.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NEXTMENU
member.summary: The WM_NEXTMENU message is sent to an application when the right or left arrow key is used to switch between the menu bar and the system menu.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SIZING
member.summary: The WM_SIZING message is sent to a window that the user is resizing. By processing this message, an application can monitor the size and position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its size or position.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CAPTURECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_CAPTURECHANGED message is sent to the window that is losing the mouse capture.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOVING
member.summary: The WM_MOVING message is sent to a window that the user is moving. By processing this message, an application can monitor the position of the drag rectangle and, if needed, change its position.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.POWERBROADCAST
member.summary: Notifies applications that a power-management event has occurred.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DEVICECHANGE
member.summary: Notifies an application of a change to the hardware configuration of a device or the computer.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDICREATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICREATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to create an MDI child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIDESTROY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIDESTROY message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to close an MDI child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIACTIVATE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIACTIVATE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to instruct the client window to activate a different MDI child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIRESTORE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIRESTORE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to restore an MDI child window from maximized or minimized size.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDINEXT
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDINEXT message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to activate the next or previous child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIMAXIMIZE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIMAXIMIZE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to maximize an MDI child window. The system resizes the child window to make its client area fill the client window. The system places the child window's window menu icon in the rightmost position of the frame window's menu bar, and places the child window's restore icon in the leftmost position. The system also appends the title bar text of the child window to that of the frame window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDITILE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDITILE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all of its MDI child windows in a tile format.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDICASCADE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDICASCADE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all its child windows in a cascade format.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIICONARRANGE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIICONARRANGE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to arrange all minimized MDI child windows. It does not affect child windows that are not minimized.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIGETACTIVE
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIGETACTIVE message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to retrieve the handle to the active MDI child window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDISETMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDISETMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to replace the entire menu of an MDI frame window, to replace the window menu of the frame window, or both.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ENTERSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window after it enters the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns. The system sends the WM_ENTERSIZEMOVE message regardless of whether the dragging of full windows is enabled.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.EXITSIZEMOVE
member.summary: The WM_EXITSIZEMOVE message is sent one time to a window, after it has exited the moving or sizing modal loop. The window enters the moving or sizing modal loop when the user clicks the window's title bar or sizing border, or when the window passes the WM_SYSCOMMAND message to the DefWindowProc function and the wParam parameter of the message specifies the SC_MOVE or SC_SIZE value. The operation is complete when DefWindowProc returns.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DROPFILES
member.summary: Sent when the user drops a file on the window of an application that has registered itself as a recipient of dropped files.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MDIREFRESHMENU
member.summary: An application sends the WM_MDIREFRESHMENU message to a multiple-document interface (MDI) client window to refresh the window menu of the MDI frame window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_SETCONTEXT
member.summary: Sent to an application when a window is activated. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_NOTIFY
member.summary: Sent to an application to notify it of changes to the IME window. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_CONTROL
member.summary: Sent by an application to direct the IME window to carry out the requested command. The application uses this message to control the IME window that it has created. To send this message, the application calls the SendMessage function with the following parameters.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_COMPOSITIONFULL
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME window finds no space to extend the area for the composition window. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_SELECT
member.summary: Sent to an application when the operating system is about to change the current IME. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_CHAR
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME gets a character of the conversion result. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_REQUEST
member.summary: Sent to an application to provide commands and request information. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_KEYDOWN
member.summary: Sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key press and to keep message order. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.IME_KEYUP
member.summary: Sent to an application by the IME to notify the application of a key release and to keep message order. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSEHOVER
member.summary: The WM_MOUSEHOVER message is posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the client area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.MOUSELEAVE
member.summary: The WM_MOUSELEAVE message is posted to a window when the cursor leaves the client area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCMOUSEHOVER
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSEHOVER message is posted to a window when the cursor hovers over the nonclient area of the window for the period of time specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.NCMOUSELEAVE
member.summary: The WM_NCMOUSELEAVE message is posted to a window when the cursor leaves the nonclient area of the window specified in a prior call to TrackMouseEvent.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.WTSSESSION_CHANGE
member.summary: The WM_WTSSESSION_CHANGE message notifies applications of changes in session state.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CUT
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CUT message to an edit control or combo box to delete (cut) the current selection, if any, in the edit control and copy the deleted text to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.COPY
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPY message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current selection to the clipboard in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PASTE
member.summary: An application sends a WM_PASTE message to an edit control or combo box to copy the current content of the clipboard to the edit control at the current caret position. Data is inserted only if the clipboard contains data in CF_TEXT format.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CLEAR
member.summary: An application sends a WM_CLEAR message to an edit control or combo box to delete (clear) the current selection, if any, from the edit control.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.UNDO
member.summary: An application sends a WM_UNDO message to an edit control to undo the last operation. When this message is sent to an edit control, the previously deleted text is restored or the previously added text is deleted.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.RENDERFORMAT
member.summary: The WM_RENDERFORMAT message is sent to the clipboard owner if it has delayed rendering a specific clipboard format and if an application has requested data in that format.
