The clipboard owner must render data in the specified format and place it on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.RENDERALLFORMATS
member.summary: The WM_RENDERALLFORMATS message is sent to the clipboard owner before it is destroyed, if the clipboard owner has delayed rendering one or more clipboard formats. For the content of the clipboard to remain available to other applications, the clipboard owner must render data in all the formats it is capable of generating, and place the data on the clipboard by calling the SetClipboardData function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DESTROYCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_DESTROYCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner when a call to the EmptyClipboard function empties the clipboard.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DRAWCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_DRAWCLIPBOARD message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when the content of the clipboard changes. This enables a clipboard viewer window to display the new content of the clipboard.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PAINTCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_PAINTCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area needs repainting.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.VSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_VSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's vertical scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SIZECLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_SIZECLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and the clipboard viewer's client area has changed size.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.ASKCBFORMATNAME
member.summary: The WM_ASKCBFORMATNAME message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window to request the name of a CF_OWNERDISPLAY clipboard format.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CHANGECBCHAIN
member.summary: The WM_CHANGECBCHAIN message is sent to the first window in the clipboard viewer chain when a window is being removed from the chain.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSCROLLCLIPBOARD
member.summary: The WM_HSCROLLCLIPBOARD message is sent to the clipboard owner by a clipboard viewer window. This occurs when the clipboard contains data in the CF_OWNERDISPLAY format and an event occurs in the clipboard viewer's horizontal scroll bar. The owner should scroll the clipboard image and update the scroll bar values.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.QUERYNEWPALETTE
member.summary: This message informs a window that it is about to receive the keyboard focus, giving the window the opportunity to realize its logical palette when it receives the focus.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PALETTEISCHANGING
member.summary: The WM_PALETTEISCHANGING message informs applications that an application is going to realize its logical palette.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PALETTECHANGED
member.summary: This message is sent by the OS to all top-level and overlapped windows after the window with the keyboard focus realizes its logical palette. This message enables windows that do not have the keyboard focus to realize their logical palettes and update their client areas.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HOTKEY
member.summary: The WM_HOTKEY message is posted when the user presses a hot key registered by the RegisterHotKey function. The message is placed at the top of the message queue associated with the thread that registered the hot key.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PRINT
member.summary: The WM_PRINT message is sent to a window to request that it draw itself in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.PRINTCLIENT
member.summary: The WM_PRINTCLIENT message is sent to a window to request that it draw its client area in the specified device context, most commonly in a printer device context.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.APPCOMMAND
member.summary: The WM_APPCOMMAND message notifies a window that the user generated an application command event, for example, by clicking an application command button using the mouse or typing an application command key on the keyboard.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.THEMECHANGED
member.summary: The WM_THEMECHANGED message is broadcast to every window following a theme change event. Examples of theme change events are the activation of a theme, the deactivation of a theme, or a transition from one theme to another.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CLIPBOARDUPDATE
member.summary: Sent when the contents of the clipboard have changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED
member.summary: The system will send a window the WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED message to indicate that the availability of desktop composition has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DWMNCRENDERINGCHANGED
member.summary: WM_DWMNCRENDERINGCHANGED is called when the non-client area rendering status of a window has changed. Only windows that have set the flag DWM_BLURBEHIND.fTransitionOnMaximized to true will get this message.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DWMCOLORIZATIONCOLORCHANGED
member.summary: Sent to all top-level windows when the colorization color has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.DWMWINDOWMAXIMIZEDCHANGE
member.summary: WM_DWMWINDOWMAXIMIZEDCHANGE will let you know when a DWM composed window is maximized. You also have to register for this message as well. You'd have other windowd go opaque when this message is sent.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.GETTITLEBARINFOEX
member.summary: Sent to request extended title bar information. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.APP
member.summary: The WM_APP constant is used by applications to help define private messages, usually of the form WM_APP+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.USER
member.summary: The WM_USER constant is used by applications to help define private messages for use by private window classes, usually of the form WM_USER+X, where X is an integer value.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CPL_LAUNCH
member.summary: An application sends the WM_CPL_LAUNCH message to Windows Control Panel to request that a Control Panel application be started.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.CPL_LAUNCHED
member.summary: The WM_CPL_LAUNCHED message is sent when a Control Panel application, started by the WM_CPL_LAUNCH message, has closed. The WM_CPL_LAUNCHED message is sent to the window identified by the wParam parameter of the WM_CPL_LAUNCH message that started the application.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.SYSTIMER
member.summary: WM_SYSTIMER is a well-known yet still undocumented message. Windows uses WM_SYSTIMER for internal actions like scrolling.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_ACCESSIBILITYSTATE
member.summary: The accessibility state has changed.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_ACTIVATESHELLWINDOW
member.summary: The shell should activate its main window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_APPCOMMAND
member.summary: The user completed an input event (for example, pressed an application command button on the mouse or an application command key on the keyboard), and the application did not handle the WM_APPCOMMAND message generated by that input. If the Shell procedure handles the WM_COMMAND message, it should not call CallNextHookEx. See the Return Value section for more information.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_GETMINRECT
member.summary: A window is being minimized or maximized. The system needs the coordinates of the minimized rectangle for the window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_LANGUAGE
member.summary: Keyboard language was changed or a new keyboard layout was loaded.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_REDRAW
member.summary: The title of a window in the task bar has been redrawn.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_TASKMAN
member.summary: The user has selected the task list. A shell application that provides a task list should return TRUE to prevent Windows from starting its task list.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_WINDOWCREATED
member.summary: A top-level, unowned window has been created. The window exists when the system calls this hook.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_WINDOWDESTROYED
member.summary: A top-level, unowned window is about to be destroyed. The window still exists when the system calls this hook.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_WINDOWACTIVATED
member.summary: The activation has changed to a different top-level, unowned window.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Win32.WM.HSHELL_WINDOWREPLACED
member.summary: A top-level window is being replaced. The window exists when the system calls this hook.

A window that can be controlled by the AppDesktop API.

member.summary: Helper struct representing the payload returned by the window event 'group-changed'

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.memberOf
member.summary: Which group array the window that the event listener was registered on is included in.
member.remarks: 'source' The window is included in sourceGroup 'target' The window is included in targetGroup 'nothing' The window is not included in sourceGroup nor targetGroup,

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.name
member.summary: The name of the window

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.reason
member.summary: The reason this event was triggered.
member.remarks: 'leave' A window has left the group due to a leave or merge with group. 'join' A window has joined the group. 'merge' Two groups have been merged together. 'disband' There are no other windows in the group

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.sourceGroup
member.summary: All the windows in the group the sourceWindow originated from

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.sourceWindowAppUuid
member.summary: The UUID of the application the sourceWindow belongs to. The source window is the window in which (merge/join/leave)group(s) was called.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.sourceWindowName
member.summary: the name of the sourcewindow. The source window is the window in which (merge/join/leave)group(s) was called.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.targetGroup
member.summary: All the windows in the group the targetWindow originated from.

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.targetWindowAppUuid
member.summary: The UUID of the application the targetWindow belongs to. The target window is the window that was passed into (merge/join)group(s).

member.name: F:Openfin.Desktop.Window.GroupChangedPayload.targetWindowName

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.Window.disableFrame(Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback,Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback)
member.summary:
Prevents a user from changing a window's size/position when using the window's frame.
'disabled-frame-bounds-changing' is generated at the start of and during a user move/size operation. 'disabled-frame-bounds-changed' is generated after a user move/size operation. The events provide the bounds that would have been applied if the frame was enabled.
'frame-enabled' is generated when a disabled frame has becomes enabled.
member.param: (Optional) A function that is called if the method succeeds.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.Window.enableFrame(Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback,Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback)
member.summary:
Re-enables user changes to a window's size/position when using the window's frame.
'disabled-frame-bounds-changing' is generated at the start of and during a user move/size operation. 'disabled-frame-bounds-changed' is generated after a user move/size operation. The events provide the bounds that would have been applied if the frame was enabled.
'frame-enabled' is generated when a disabled frame has becomes enabled.
member.param: (Optional) A function that is called if the method succeeds.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.name: M:Openfin.Desktop.Window.joinGroup(Openfin.Desktop.Window,Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback,Openfin.Desktop.AckCallback)
member.summary: Joins the same window group as the specified window.
member.remarks: When windows are joined, if the user moves one of the windows, all other windows in the same group move too. This function is to be used when docking to other windows. If the window is already within a group, it will leave that group to join the new one. Windows must be owned by the same application in order to be joined.
member.param: The window whose group is to be joined.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method succeeds.
(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.summary: Merges the instance's window group with the same window group as the specified window.
member.remarks: When windows are joined, if the user moves one of the windows, all other windows in the same group move too. This function is to be used when docking to other windows. If the window is already within a group, The two groups are joined to create a new one. Windows must be owned by the same application in order to be joined.

(Optional) A function that is called if the method fails. The reason for failure is passed as an argument.

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.WindowOptions.DefaultCentered
member.summary:
The DefaultCentered property specifies that the window will be positioned in the center of the primary monitor when loaded for the first time on a machine.
Default: false
member.remarks: When the window corresponding to that id is loaded again, the position from before the window was closed is used.
member.value: The DefaultCentered property gets/sets the value of the underlying JObject field, "defaultCentered".

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.WindowOptions.DefaultHeight
member.summary:
The DefaultHeight property represents the window's default height in pixels.
Default: 500
member.remarks: Specifies the height of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When a window with the same name and parent application UUID is loaded again, the height is taken to be the last height of the window before it was closed.
member.value: The DefaultHeight property gets/sets the value of the underlying JObject field, "defaultHeight".

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.WindowOptions.DefaultLeft
member.summary:
The DefaultLeft property represents the window's default left position.
Default: 100
member.remarks: Specifies the left position of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When a window with the same name and parent application UUID is loaded again, the value of left is taken to be the last value before the window was closed.
member.value: The DefaultLeft property gets/sets the value of the underlying JObject field, "defaultLeft".

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.WindowOptions.DefaultTop
member.summary:
The DefaultTop property represents the window's default top position.
Default: 100
member.remarks: Specifies the top position of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When a window with the same name and parent application UUID is loaded again, the value of top is taken to be the last value before the window was closed.
member.value: The DefaultTop property gets/sets the value of the underlying JObject field, "defaultTop".

member.name: P:Openfin.Desktop.WindowOptions.DefaultWidth
member.summary:
The DefaultWidth property represents the window's default width in pixels.

member.remarks: Specifies the width of the window when loaded for the first time on a machine. When a window with the same name and parent application UUID is loaded again, the height is taken to be the last width of the window before it was closed.
